comment_text: Thank you so much. That's awesome. I have become convinced that science is a language. You run into problem only if you fail to understand what it is saying. I feel like beginning all over again my tortuous journey into physics with you by my side.
helpful, thank you

You could use the expression delta U = Q-W with the following convention:
Q is + if it is added to the system
Q is - if it is removed from the system
W is + if it is done to the system
W is - if it is done by the system.

hi

I am really confused. Other youtube tutorials used U = Q - W initially. For example: what is the change of internal energy in the system if 300J of heat is added and 200J of work done on the system. In analyzing, Q is +300J while W is -200J. For other tutorials, they used the formula: U= Q - W, hence U = +300 - (-200J) = +500J. While the tutorials here, the formula will based on the analysis, hence: U = +300J - 200J = +100J. What is really the correct way of solving internal energy? Thank you for your time.

u could say for 
(delta)U = (delta)Q + (delta)W
where
(delta)Q = (heat given to the system) - (heat taken away from the system)
and
(delta)W = (work done on the system) - (work done by the system)

This way you can just plug and chug instead of tying to figure out the signs of Q and W

Q = Energy gained by the system.
W = Energy lost from the system.
U = Total energy of the system before losing or gaining energy.
